|prod_website = }} 'The Challenge' (originally known as 'Road Rules: All Stars',
followed by 'Real World/Road Rules Challenge') is a reality game show on MTV
that is spun off from and mostly cast-contestant dependent on the network's two
flagship reality shows, [[The Real World]] and the now cancelled [[Road
Rules]]. The Challenge has developed a spin-off series in its own
right, [[Spring Break Challenge]]. The Challenge and Spring Break Challenge have
a somewhat cast-contestant interdependent relationship in that both programs
have used at least one or more contestants from the other. The Challenge is
currently hosted by T. J. Lavin.

The series premiered on June 1, 1998. The title of the show was originally
[[Road Rules: All Stars]] before it was renamed Real World/Road Rules Challenge
by the show's 2nd season, then later abridged to simply The Challenge by the
show's . The series initially used no hosts but instead a former cast member who
had been kicked off his or her season, providing assignments as "Mr." or "Ms.
Big" (David "Puck" Rainey, , and Gladys Sanabria served this role). Later on,
however, the series began using hosts: Eric Nies and co-hosted a season, and
Jonny Moseley and Dave Mirra hosted various seasons before T. J. Lavin became
the show's regular host by the .

Since the 4th season, each season has supplied the show with a unique subtitle,
such as "[[The Challenge: Rivals|Rivals]]." Each season consists of a format and
theme whereby the subtitle is derived. Of each season's format and theme, 6 have
been repeated or revamped through sequel seasons with shared subtitles. In
chronological order, these include: [[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: Battle of
the Sexes|Battle of the Sexes]] (tied to [[Real World/Road Rules Challenge:
Battle of the Sexes II|Battle of the Sexes II]], the show's first sequel
season); [[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: The Inferno|The Inferno]] (tied to
[[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: The Inferno II|The Inferno II]] and [[Real
World/Road Rules Challenge: The Inferno III|The Inferno III]], the show's first
trilogy); [[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: The Gauntlet|The Gauntlet]] (tied
to [[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: The Gauntlet II|The Gauntlet II]] and
[[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: The Gauntlet III|The Gauntlet III]]); [[Real
World/Road Rules Challenge: The Duel|The Duel]] (tied to [[Real World/Road Rules
Challenge: The Duel II|The Duel II]]); [[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: Fresh
Meat|Fresh Meat]] (tied to [[The Challenge: Fresh Meat II|Fresh Meat II]]); and
[[Real World/Road Rules Challenge: Battle of the Seasons|Battle of the Seasons]]
(tied to the second ).
